intro: Muraltia poiretii, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, hibiscus-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adaptable to various soil types. Muraltia poiretii thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
